Package com.atakmap.comms

Class CotStreamListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.comms.CotStreamListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CotServiceRemote.ConnectionListener, CotServiceRemote.OutputsChangedListener, Disposable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CotMapServerListener, SelfCoordOverlayUpdater
    public class CotStreamListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements CotServiceRemote.OutputsChangedListener, CotServiceRemote.ConnectionListener, Disposable
    Class to connect to CotService and keep track of CoT Streams (e.g. TAK Server connections)

      • _streams

        protected final java.util.List<TAKServer> _streams
        List of streams and their current state (e.g. enabled, connected) Note, currently when a connection is disabled we remove the stream from the list

        context - the context to use for the StreamListener
        name - The name of the stream listener
        eventListener - [optional]
        bConnect - True to connect immediately, false to manually do so later via init()

      • onCotServiceConnected

        public void onCotServiceConnected​(android.os.Bundle fullServiceState)
        Specified by:
        onCotServiceConnected in interface CotServiceRemote.ConnectionListener
        Parameters:
        fullServiceState - (Bundle[]) fullServiceState.getParcelableArray("streams") which appears to be and array of all of the current TAK servers bundle made up of TAKServer.DESCRIPTION_KEY, TAKServer.ENABLED_KEY, TAKServer.CONNECTED_KEY lifted from CotStreamListener

        fullServiceState can also contain (Bundle[]) fullServiceState.getParcelableArray(getPortType()) which follows the same rules above. lifted from CotPortListActivity
